website_summaries.verdict: An advanced student model with the quality and durability to last for many years.
pros: Easier for a younger player to hold
New connection from low B to C-sharp, promoting clear response from lower range
cons: If it sounds out of tune, check to make sure that you've removed all of the shipping cork wedges,

customer_reviews.title: YAS -280 dessign PROBLEMMMMM ~~
customer_reviews.text: YAS 280 alto saxophone cheap price and sound good make me happy . but this saxophone built the F key and #F key too close .when player play #F note . the two key bump together and make noise sound . when play fast note or solo . sounds more louder and finger feel something against . as a saxophone play I think I need tell people who want buy this brand and hope YAHAMA company can see my massage fix this problem .as famous saxophone brand this is big problem .hope YAMAHA fix it quickly make more sax player consider this brand sax .
customer_reviews.author: andy Li

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha Quality and K-Digital Customer Service Amazing
customer_reviews.text: We bought this saxophone for my 11 year old and he is extremely happy with the quality of the saxophone but what I am most impressed is with K-Digital customer services, professionalism and trustworthiness. We had an unfortunate experience when we first received the saxophone and regardless of the situation K-Digital was able to revert it spending additional costs and going above and beyond expectations. The combination of buying a Yamaha and K-Digital was amazing but I strongly recommend any purchase to K-Digital as you will be 100% satisfied. Suppliers as honorable as K-Digital are rear.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Fernandez de B F

customer_reviews.title: Sounds very good. I bought it to replace a cheap 300$ ...
customer_reviews.text: Sounds very good. I bought it to replace a cheap 300$ saxophone that I bought and this one sounds much better.
customer_reviews.author: happy consumer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Student model Alto-Saxophone
customer_reviews.text: This saxophone is excellent for the beginning student. However, there was no neck strap included and young players must use a neck strap to help hold the instrument. Although the product description did not mention a neck strap, parents of beginning players would assume that all necessary materials for the first lesson were included. It would be unfortunate for a student to not be able to participate in the first music lesson because of the absence of the neck strap. For this reason I gave the product 4 out of 5 stars. Product arrived well packaged and in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: flowrladee

customer_reviews.title: Not much to say except it is a great sax. This is my first sax and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Not much to say except it is a great sax. This is my first sax and I spent more than I should have, but I don't have any regrets getting this model.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Ku

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner.
customer_reviews.text: My son happy with this and had problem on some key tone for the first time. But found one more spacer was not removed because hard to see it. Afer removing it, perfect sound and well balanced tone.
customer_reviews.author: HongJaeUn

customer_reviews.title: It's a genuine Yamaha instrument shipped from S. Korea.
customer_reviews.text: It was sold by K-media (?) and shipped from S. Korea. I had little concern about if I had to pay a customs duty since it comes from overseas. Everything was fine and it arrived quickly in a well-packaged Yamaha box. Make sure you take out all corks placed in various places in the instrument before complaining it's not working! It's a good instrument and a big thumbs up for the seller!
customer_reviews.author: Wilkimondad

customer_reviews.title: Best Saxophone we've had
customer_reviews.text: We have bought the Mendini before this, and the keys broke a lot. Once my son tried the Yamaha out, there was a significant difference. So glad I spent the money for a better Sax for him. Definitely worth the money. In this case, you definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jusmama

customer_reviews.title: delivered on time; good product
customer_reviews.text: No one mentioned that there is a "duty" charge for this to come into the U.S.A. The sax came from Japan. Today I received a $80.00 bill in the mail for "duty" charge. I think this should be made clear when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: moth

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES it. Great look and sound! I got a separate neck holder, the one included is very basic.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Azpurua

customer_reviews.title: Brand new in the box
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase, wasn't sure when placing the order but was very glad to see the product in sealed brand new in Yamaha box.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: We started out with a cheap basic rental for my son for the first year and decided to get him an upgrade and upgrade it is.
customer_reviews.author: steven dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Great intermediate horn
customer_reviews.text: Got for my 14yo son. He plays jazz and regular band. Good sound, accurate notes, spin loves it.
customer_reviews.author: derrick

customer_reviews.title: quality of porduct
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift for My grandson He loves his new saxophone said his teachers also liked it
customer_reviews.author: GAP

customer_reviews.title: great sound. some painting missing at the inner side ...
customer_reviews.text: from a beginner: great sound. some painting missing at the inner side of keys but they are not visible to others. need to buy pad saver and cleaning kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shipped overseas and arrived in 3 days
customer_reviews.text: Got it for 6th grader, the band teacher appreciated the quality of the saxaphone.
customer_reviews.author: Arunkumar Sivasankaran

customer_reviews.title: Very nice instrument and case.
customer_reviews.text: The neck band is a little uncomfortable. Needs some padding. Wish the case had wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Lynn Beard

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very good and fast shipping all the way from Japan !!!
customer_reviews.author: Pete 379

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful instrument and sounds great! The case with the backpack carry availability is really awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyKong

customer_reviews.title: 0 Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son used the item for only 4days, one of its tabs leaked air and functioned weird. We contacted prime trade USA but we never got any reply!
customer_reviews.author: Min Pan

customer_reviews.title: Made in Indonesia.
customer_reviews.text: Review was made in Japan but delivered made in Indonesia. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex s. Shin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: somthing wrong. I want to return this item. how can I do this ?
customer_reviews.author: andrew oh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing saxophone.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought a Yamaha in the first place. All I can say is WOW. The YAS280 is an amazing horn. The sound is deep and rich, can go from low Bb to high F# with relative ease. Seller GJG stands behind their products. All mine needed was an initial setup adjustment. The Technician was impressed with the YAS280 , it was the first time he had seen this model.
customer_reviews.author: Name withheld to protect the innocent

customer_reviews.title: Great "beginner" level Alto Sax - Made in INDONESIA (for Yamaha of Japan)(see photo)
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level Saxophone! Highly recommended, and highly recommend purchasing from a verified local music store which will support instrument adjustment, repair and local customer service. To clear up any confusion, these instruments are Yamaha brand, headquarter in Japan, but this particular model is indeed made in Indonesia. Please see attached photo.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy T.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry level saxophone
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent entry level saxophone used in many school programs. The fit and finish are quite good for the level. Attention to detail with respect to the action is very good. The pads are aligned well and will last for many years. The tone is warm and the action is quite smooth. The case is a canvas case with carrying straps and shoulder straps for easy transport. I definitely recommend this for your beginner. It costs much more than average but it also has a great resale value.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle VisionTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Strong USD = buy YAS280.
customer_reviews.text: Take advantage of the favorable strong us dollar and buy the YAS280 instead of the YAS26. This sax isn't sold in the USA but can be purchased at amazing value. This is a great beginner sax that can grow with a responsible young player until they are ready to step up to a professional level sax...no need to buy an intermediate level sax with this one.
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: A student Sax that’s good enough for a professional
customer_reviews.text: All Yamaha instruments have the highest level design and manufacturing. This is a great saxophone for a beginner, and many times band directors will insist student start out on this one because it’s easier to play than most others. There are professionals who keep these horns as back ups they are so good. By all means avoid the cheap, $300 Chinese saxes; they are difficult to play and many repair shops won’t even touch them because they are so poorly manufactured. Band directors generally won’t let their students play the cheap Chinese horns for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Lee
